title: L<foo|#method bar> Links Are Broken on Individual Generated Pages
body:
If you visit http://doc.perl6.org/routine/push and try to click the `method append` link at the bottom of `routine push` section, nothing will happen, because target `#method_push` doesn't exist on that page. It does exist on the full page, from which the aforementioned page was generated: http://doc.perl6.org/type/Array#method_append

Whatever's generating those pages need to account that `L<>` links need to be expanded. Currently, all of these links are likely broken (grep on `doc/` dir of this repo:)

``` bash
$ grep -iER '[<|]#method' .
./Type/CurrentThreadScheduler.pod:that L<#method cue> blocks until the code has finished executing.
./Type/IO/Socket.pod:connection. The binary version is L<#method write>.
./Type/IO/Socket.pod:connection. The string version is L<#method send>.
./Type/IO/Socket/INET.pod:For text operations (such as L<#method lines> and L<#method get>),
./Type/Supply.pod:The L<live method|#method live> returns C<True> on live supplies. Factory
./Type/Supply.pod:methods such as L<interval|#method interval>, L<from-list|#method from-list>
./Type/Metamodel/AttributeContainer.pod:Returns a true value if L<method set_rw|#method set_rw> has been called on
./Type/Array.pod:See L<method append|#method append> for when you want to append multiple
./Type/Array.pod:The notes in L<the documentation for method push|#method push> apply,
./Type/Array.pod:L<#method prepend> is the equivalent for adding multiple elements from one
./Type/Match.pod:Returns the payload that was set with L<#method make>.
./Type/Match.pod:Alias for L<#method made>.
./Type/Proc/Async.pod:You must call C<stdout> before you call L<#method start>. Otherwise an
./Type/Proc/Async.pod:You must call C<stderr> before you call L<#method start>. Otherwise an
./Type/Proc/Async.pod:waiting for the promise from C<#method start> hangs (for a program opened for
./Type/Cool.pod:The inverse operation is L<chr|#method chr>.
./Type/Cool.pod:The inverse operation is L<ord|#method ord>.
./Type/DateTime.pod:L<#method timezone>.
./Type/DateTime.pod:The formatting function is called by L<#method Str> with the invocant as its
./Type/DateTime.pod:L<the formatter|#method formatter>.
./Type/DateTime.pod:Negative offsets are allowed, though L<#method earlier> is more idiomatic for
./Type/DateTime.pod:towards the past applied. See L<#method later> for usage.
./Type/Parameter.pod:L<alias|#method named_names>.  Often, the name will chosen descriptively
./Type/Parameter.pod:L<rw|#method_rw>-parameter which can only bind to variables, never to values.
./Type/Parameter.pod:L<sigil|#method sigil> of C<'\'>, which is not really a sigil insofar
./Language/subscripts.pod:See L<#method BIND-POS> and L<#method BIND-KEY> for the underlying mechanism.
./Language/subscripts.pod:See L<#method EXISTS-POS> and L<#method EXISTS-KEY> for the underlying
./Language/subscripts.pod:See L<#method DELETE-POS> and L<#method DELETE-KEY> for the underlying
./Language/subscripts.pod:|#Methods_to_implement_for_positional_subscripting>) for your custom type.
```
